To put the vertical deformation estimates into a continental framework, we use data from four continuous GNSS stations (inverted triangles in Fig. 1A) with high-quality time series in a stable North American reference frame (NA12) (
24 ). We apply a 1D conformal transformation (shift and scale factor) to transfer the results from the local combined InSAR and GNSS measurements into NA12 (see Methods for details). We find an SD of 0.52 mm/year for the difference between our estimated U velocities and those observed at the continuous GNSS stations provided by Blewitt et al. (
24 ).
